results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).

results.title: To climb a mountain
results.creator_credit: Ted Abenheim, Dennis Passaggio and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows how blindness is a handicap that can be overcome. Presents a story about a young man and woman and a group of their friends who successfully climb a mountain. Explores their feelings about their accomplishments as blind people and examines the attitudes of society about blindness.

results.title: Tires
results.creator_credit: Yehuda Yaniv and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Observes tyre sculptor William Weisz as he recycles discarded tyres into dragons, elephants, and other creative shapes and structures. Traces this process from the original manufacture of the tyres to the installation of the sculptures as safe and durable playground equipment. Without narration.

results.title: Tire wise
results.brief_description: Gives information about buying and using automobile tyres, including their manufacture, how the three main types of tyres differ, and how to get maximum tyre mileage and driving safety. Includes details on skids, chains, changing a tyre and hydroplaning.

results.title: Timpani
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”
A demonstration of the kettle drums, showing the complications of the tuning of each drum to the required pitch. The modern pedal kettle drum has a mechanism for automatic adjustment of the skin. A tuning gauge helps the timpanist to determine his pitch.

results.title: Time of wonder
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Watercolours and the rhythmic prose from the book written & illustrated by Robert McCloskey are combined to create an awareness of the wonders of nature on an island in Penobscot Bay, Maine.
results.description: Watercolours and the rhythmic prose from the book written & illustrated by Robert McCloskey are combined to create an awareness of the wonders of nature on an island in Penobscot Bay, Maine.

results.title: Time of the horn
results.brief_description: An aimless afternoon becomes a melodic adventure when a small boy retrieves a discarded trumpet from an alley rubbish basket. Oblivious of the stares of passers-by, he pretends to play the horn as he skips and struts down the busy street, lost in a jazz fantasy of his own imagining. Recalled to reality by his mother’s voice, he scampers home, still tightly clutching his new-found prize.

results.title: The Time of man
results.creator_credit: Marshall Flaum and Metromedia Producers Corporation
results.brief_description:
Man’s position in the long chain of evolution is portrayed with special emphasis on the problems of survival, pointing up man’s natural connection with all living organisms. Part of the series “The Natural history of the world” this film is presented in three sections:
I - Evolution and survival
II - Man and his humanity
III - Man’s modern history and survival
Narrated by Richard Basehart.

results.title: Time and place
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A study of our living environment in all its variety. Capturing the mood of today’s living, grasping at images of a graceful, more leisurely past, and examining alternative paths into the future. Without commentary, this deeply perceptive film establishes a basis for comparison of environmental situations, and asks the viewer to make their own choice. Begins with the documentation of Christo’s wrapping of the Sydney cove coastline (shot through a rose coloured lens in the final scenes).

results.title: Time and clocks
results.brief_description: John G. King discusses concepts of time measurement and demonstrates devices used to measure and record time intervals from one second down to .0000000001 second, with possible extension by a further five places in certain cases. Points out the problem of verifying accuracy of a clock and considers briefly psychological time and the possibility of a limit to division of time.
